channel.title: Choose the fate of the minecraft server
channel.description:
Either way, we will go with Bukkit when released, or hey0-mod if someone else comes out with a fix before Bukkit is released.
Keep in mind if we revert to the previous version, we will all have to have that specific version client. The newest one won't work.
Discuss.

item.title: Choose the fate of the minecraft server
item.dc:creator: @ZeROExIT ZeROExIT
item.description:
@ZeROExIT wrote:

http://www.minecraftforum.net/viewtopic.php?f=1012&t=24604

Read full topic

item.title: Choose the fate of the minecraft server
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:52, topic:378334”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=474210.msg3473872#msg3473872 date=1295511109]
I just reverted.
[/quote]

I downloaded the client Corey posted with auto updating

What do?[/quote]

Follow the same instructions. Replace the minecraft.jar (a 1.1 version) after running minecraft.exe once. This will degrade the version down to 1.1 but the screen will say 1.2 because the version file has not changed.

Ohai, 1000th post.

Read full topic

item.title: Choose the fate of the minecraft server
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:50, topic:378334”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=474210.msg3474042#msg3474042 date=1295540089]

I just reverted.
[/quote]When Bukkit is released, will we be switching over? I don’t think we should unless the plugins are compatible, or they have the plugins we need. (Authentication and chest protection)

Yes, we will be switching. I believe all the plugins are already ported over, if not, I can probably handle it if source is available, or there will be alternatives.

I don’t know if bukkit will ever be released, they have their heads so far up notch’s ass he is choking on their hair, they refuse to release it without approval of mojang, and that might never happen.[/quote]If that is the case, maybe we should write our own?

But anyhow, I don’t know if you got my personal message, but for some reason it seems that some people can’t authenticate with the mod. I don’t know if it just didn’t read the database correctly or what, but I can’t log in

Read full topic

I just reverted.
[/quote]When Bukkit is released, will we be switching over? I don’t think we should unless the plugins are compatible, or they have the plugins we need. (Authentication and chest protection)[/quote]

Yes, we will be switching. I believe all the plugins are already ported over, if not, I can probably handle it if source is available, or there will be alternatives.

I don’t know if bukkit will ever be released, they have their heads so far up notch’s ass he is choking on their hair, they refuse to release it without approval of mojang, and that might never happen.

item.source: Choose the fate of the minecraft server

item.title: Choose the fate of the minecraft server
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

I still think we should use the unofficial Hm0d release I found, he really is working on those bugs…
only ones left are…

[ul][li] Stargate doesn't work (Fairly known one and is confirmed to not work)[/li] [li] Animals aren't spawning.[/li] [li] Monsters aren't spawning.[/li] [li] Levers won't flip up or down and they sometimes move the block but they work.[/li] [li] Craftbook doesn't work.[/li] [li] The HUD doesn't have the extra effect from the patch update where the items grow larger then shrink back to normal size to indicate you picked something up.[/li] [li]Cuboid doesn't work. (From post below) - Author issue[/li][/ul]

Again, what do you guys think? All the bugs will probably be fixed in a few more days, and Bukkit still looks like it needs a while to get going.

Read full topic

try it, or just stick with 1.1_02?
